Show HN: DoxyJS. A for-fun and homemade symbolic regression app for the browser
text:
Dear HN: Here's a side project I've been tinkering with for awhile. There's an explanation in the PDF doc. If you've ever used Eureqa, it's a bit like that.

Although it's not the most fine-tuned example of this type of genetic code, and JS is hardly the ideal way to chew through lots of data, it does work, and it does things in its own way fairly well. I'll leave it up to the fine folks here to mess around with.

This is absolutely a hobby project, but it may actually help you, so I'd like to put it out there before it's too late.

I have a couple similar projects; another involves Markov chains to let you predict the future while telling stories. That one requires server power, so I'm keeping it private.

I've been asking myself: Why make this public? It's not for money. Not really for acclaim. I'd like to be a little like _why ...I'd like to be someone you associate with being skilled at what I do. I thought maybe I should bulk up some social media presence before giving this out, but, who cares.

Here's a cool piece of code, have fun with it.

Math.js deserves most of the credit, anyway.

title: Show HN: Free Chrome extension to summarize articles using ChatGPT AI
Ask HN: Edge-Cases in Software Demos
text:
I'm working on tooling to automatically edit software demo-meetings into video recaps. (E.g. an automatic 90 second "highlight reel" video from each 40 min software demo).

What are some edge-cases in your software demos (or things you can think of) which could cause this system to struggle?

Here's some we've already worked around:

- What if the content is obscured e.g. by the webcams in Zoom?

- What if the user tabs quickly between different things and back?

- What if a modal covers what the presenter is showing?

Some edge-cases we know of but have yet to solve:

- What if the presenter hands control to the user and they do the demo as the presenter explains it

Interested in any difficult edge-cases (real or imagined) which would cause our automatic highlight-reel creation to fail.
